e4: Changing to the new policy enhances transparency and ethical integrity in financial reporting, aligning with standards that prioritize truthful disclosure. Although there may be initial market adjustments, the company mitigates potential legal liabilities and improves trust with a wider range of investors, including those who value accurate data.
e5: An ethical reporting policy ensures accuracy, transparency, and consistency, providing truthful information to all stakeholders. It avoids intentional misrepresentations or biases that could mislead investors or provide undue advantage to certain groups. In context, it should also consider the clarity of communication during policy changes and the education of all investor classes to prevent misunderstandings.
e6: Yes, I would ask how the management plans to communicate the change to all stakeholders to ensure they understand the new policy. Additionally, I would inquire about the timeline for transition and whether there will be support systems for retail investors to comprehend the change.
